text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

I thought, today we should honor some social
media platforms.

Awhile ago I made some social media cake pops,
and I also made Twitter Tea Biscuits.

And I thought we gotta honor one of theses
platforms, so today,
Instagram, it’s your turn!

I love you, I use you a lot, today we’re
gonna make some Instagram Brownies,
let’s get started!

The brownie recipe that I’m gonna be using today
is the one from my Nerdy Nummies

Cookbook, and today we are going to double
it, we’re going to make

a double batch. So, the things you’ll need,
will be: 1 cup of vegetable oil,

1 cup of all purpose flour, 2 cups and 4 tablespoons
of sugar, 1/2 a teaspoon

of salt, 1/2 a teaspoon of baking powder,
2 teaspoons of vanilla extract,

2/3 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 large
eggs and 2/3 cup of whole milk.

And then the things you’ll need to decorate
will be: some regular sized Oreos,

mini Oreos, Rainbow Airhead Extremes Bites,
some creamy peanut butter,

to make these a chocolate peanut butter brownie,
yummy-yummy-yummy-yummy-yummy!

And then 2 cookie cutters, here I have a smaller
circle, and a square.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing we’re gonna do is we are gonna
whisk together our dry ingredients

in a medium sized bowl, so we are gonna add our
sugar, flour, cocoa powder, salt,
and baking powder!

Then we’re gonna start some whisky things!
We’re going to whisk together
until it’s well combined!

Now we’re gonna add in our wet ingredients,
we’re gonna pour in our oil,
milk, vanilla extract, and our 2 eggs.

Now we’re gonna whisk it together 1 more
time until it’s well combined!
It smells delicious!

Our brownie batter is all ready, and now we
are gonna prep our pan.

So I’m gonna do is, baking spray, parchment
paper, baking spray!

So that the brownies won’t stick to the
bottom and they’re really

easy to take out. Oh my gosh! This looks amazing!
It smells so good!

Now it’s time to bake our brownies. For
the original recipe if you’re doing

a single batch you’re gonna bake it at 350
degrees for 20 to 25 minutes,

but because we’re doing a double batch,
we’re going to slow bake, we’re

going to reduce the heat to 325 and bake for
40-45 minutes, just keep your eye

on ‘em! Once the brownies have baked and
had plenty of time to cool,
now we’re gonna cut out some squares.

If you don’t have a square cookie cutter,
that’s fine, you can just use a sharp

cutting knife, just be careful
of your fingers.

So I’m gonna take my little cookie cutter,
I’ve got it on top of a little cutting

board, and I’m just gonna press down, and
pop ‘em out.

And I’m putting it right over here onto
this little baking mat.

Oh my gosh, Look at that! That’s gonna be
hard not to take a bite, but we
gotta wait, we just gotta wait! OK...

Then we’re gonna cut out the rest of our
brownies!

Here are our brownie squares, they’re all
cut out, you can use the excess

brownies, you know, the crust that was all
the way around that we cut them

out of to make brownie pops. You can do whatever
you want with them, for snacks

or whatever, but I like to use them to make
Brownie Pops.
So… Good! So… Yummy!

OK, so the next thing we’re gonna do is
decorate, this is my favorite thing.

So you’re gonna take one of these little brownies,
you’re gonna bring him over here.

You’re gonna take 1 of your little
Airhead bites, look at that,
they’re just perfect!  So I'm gonna place him on top, just to eyeball how far up I want to frost the peanut butter,
to make it look like the Instagram logo!

So in here, in this little plastic decorating
baggie. I just scooped some peanut

butter in and I put a number 4 tip for more
control.

You don’t need to do this, you can scoop
the peanut butter on top of the brownie
and use a little spatula to flatten it out.

I’m gonna make the line right below it.
So I’m just gonna go across, do the edges
first and then I’m gonna fill it in!

Oh my gosh! Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownies!
Yes!

Our brownies are now chocolate peanut butter
brownies and now we’re gonna add

the last decoration, Oreos, we’re using
regular and small, starting with regular.

And what you’re gonna do, take your little Oreo
and twist ‘em, ooooh!

And then we’re gonna scrape off the yummy
part, we’re gonna scrape off the

filling so that it is clean on the back, and
now we’re gonna cut out our circles.

They’re almost the right size, I just want
them to be a little bit smaller.
So this is where you can use a cookie cutter!

Line it up, and I have to put like, all my
body weight
Oh! There we go!
Then pop him out!

And that is gonna be the lens, we are gonna
put that right in the middle of all of our Instagram

brownies. Now for the second part you’re

and do the same thing, you’re gonna twist
them apart, ooooh!

And you’re just gonna scrape off the good
stuff, aw!
This is the sad part!
Oooh! But I could eat it! So then it's happy again!
Nom-nom-nom-nom!

I’m gonna take a very sharp cutting knife,
be careful, don’t get your fingers,

and I’m just gonna cut a square. Then you’re
gonna stick this little guy

right up here in the upper right hand corner
to be the little view finders!

They are adorable! They are so easy to make!
I got a lot of requests from

you guys to make some easier recipes, so I
Really hope that you’ve been

enjoying them. And, I’ll be taking lots
of pictures of these guys and I’ll

be putting them on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook

I love seeing your baking creations, it just

Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
